page.title: 08CATHOLES
page.content: {Catholes}is a small group of buildings dating back to the 15/16th century situated about a mile south-east of Sedbergh alongside the river Dee. One of the farm buildings has been converted into 'bunkhouse' type accommodation for visiting groups - schools etc. Unusual markings on the original beams, taken from the old sailing ships coming into Maryport, indicate the age and 'authenticity' of the buildings. The area is dominated by deciduous woodland in which there is a small lime kiln. A small mound near to Abbott Holme Bridge (a Roman bridge) indicates the position of an old Roman fort and the vegetation mirrors the boundary of the fort.
